import ast

# Check all modified files for syntax errors
files_to_check = [''trackmodel_working.py'', ''trackmodel_testinterfaces.py'', ''Inputs.py'']
all_good = True

for filename in files_to_check:
    try:
        with open(filename, ''r'') as f:
            ast.parse(f.read(), filename)
        print(f''OK {filename}: Syntax valid'')
    except SyntaxError as e:
        print(f''ERROR {filename}: Syntax Error - {e}'')
        all_good = False
    except FileNotFoundError:
        print(f''ERROR {filename}: File not found'')
        all_good = False

if all_good:
    print(''All files have valid syntax!'')
else:
    print(''Some files have syntax errors!'')
")

# Simple test of yard buffer functionality
class YardBuffer:
    def __init__(self):
        self.current_buffer = []
        self.is_complete = False
    def add_next_block(self, block_number):
        if not self.is_complete:
            self.current_buffer.append(block_number)
            if len(self.current_buffer) == 4 and self.current_buffer == [63, 64, 65, 66]:
                self.is_complete = True
                return True
        return False

# Test yard buffer
yard_buffer = YardBuffer()
print(''Testing Yard Buffer:'')
print(f''  Added 63: {yard_buffer.add_next_block(63)}'')
print(f''  Added 64: {yard_buffer.add_next_block(64)}'')  
print(f''  Added 65: {yard_buffer.add_next_block(65)}'')
print(f''  Added 66: {yard_buffer.add_next_block(66)} (should be True)'')
print(f''  Buffer: {yard_buffer.current_buffer}'')
print(''Yard buffer test completed successfully!'')
")
